doc.title: Semiconductor Production Equipment Industry Implications of SEMI's SPE Market Forecast
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/MS/Semiconductor Production Equipment Industry Implications of SEMIs SPE Market ForecastSemiconductor Production Equipment _2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/MS
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/MS

passages.text: August 28, 2025 08:04 AM GMT

On August 26, SEMI presented its forecast for the semiconductor production equipment market, confirming that from 2025 onward, growth in test- related equipment is set to greatly outpace that for WFE, and that foundry and logic applications will continue to represent the largest market segments by application. We remain OW on Disco and Advantest.

SEMI presented its market forecast on Aug 26. It forecasts YoY growth in the equipment market at \(2025 + 7\%\) , \(2026 + 10\%\) . SEMI's WFE market YoY growth forecasts are \(2025 + 6\%\) , \(2026 + 10\%\) . We expect relatively low growth for Japan- made equipment as investment accelerates and production is localized in China. SEMI's YoY growth forecasts for inspection equipment are \(2025 + 23\%\) , \(2026 + 5\%\) ; for assembly equipment, \(2025 + 8\%\) , \(2026 + 15\%\) . By application, SEMI expects foundry and logic to remain the largest segments, accounting for \(>60\%\) of the market in 2025 onward; it expects memory equipment demand to recover. Advantest is the global leader in inspection equipment, for which SEMI expects high growth in 2025. Disco is the top Japanese player in assembly equipment, for which SEMI expects strong growth in 2026.

SEMI expects solid SPE market growth: SEMI presented its latest forecasts for the SPE market via its market update on August 26. There were no major changes from the outlook presented in July. According to SEMI, the SPE market is set to grow \(7\%\) YoY in 2025 to a record- high \(125.5bn\) , and \(10\%\) YoY in 2026 to \(138.1bn\) . The wafer fabrication equipment (WFE) market grew \(8\%\) YoY to \(104bn\) in 2024, driven by aggressive investment from Chinese manufacturers, marking a new record high; SEMI expects it to grow \(6\%\) YoY to \(111bn\) in 2025 and \(10\%\) YoY to \(122bn\) in 2026. We also expect the market for WFE, in which companies like Tokyo Electron, Screen Holdings, Kokusai Electric, and Ulvac operate, will continue to grow in 2025 and 2026, and SEMI's outlook seems reasonable, but we also see a risk of demand for Japan- made equipment underperforming the broader WFE market amid China's push to localize production of SPE.
MORGAN STANLEY MUFG SECURITIES CO., LTD +

SPE market via its market update on August 26. There were no major changes from the outlook presented in July. According to SEMI, the SPE market is set to grow \(7\%\) YoY in 2025 to a record- high \(125.5bn\) , and \(10\%\) YoY in 2026 to \(138.1bn\) . The wafer fabrication equipment (WFE) market grew \(8\%\) YoY to \(104bn\) in 2024, driven by aggressive investment from Chinese manufacturers, marking a new record high; SEMI expects it to grow \(6\%\) YoY to \(111bn\) in 2025 and \(10\%\) YoY to \(122bn\) in 2026. We also expect the market for WFE, in which companies like Tokyo Electron, Screen Holdings, Kokusai Electric, and Ulvac operate, will continue to grow in 2025 and 2026, and SEMI's outlook seems reasonable, but we also see a risk of demand for Japan- made equipment underperforming the broader WFE market amid China's push to localize production of SPE.

Morgan Stanley does and seeks to do business with companies covered in Morgan Stanley Research. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of Morgan Stanley Research. Investors should consider Morgan Stanley Research as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
For analyst certification and other important disclosures, refer to the Disclosure Section, located at the end of this report.

\(+ =\) Analysts employed by non- U.S. affiliates are not registered with FINRA, may not be associated persons of the member and may not be subject to FINRA restrictions on communications with a subject company, public appearances and trading securities held by a research analyst account.

Growth in back- end equipment market to significantly outpace WFE growth in 2025: SEMI data on the back- end equipment market indicate that the inspection equipment market (an area in which Advantest competes) shrank \(19\%\) YoY to \(\) 7.5bn\(in 2024, while the assembly equipment market (an area in which Disco competes) grew\) 28\% \(YoY to\) \ \(5.1bn\) . SEMI expects higher growth than WFE on average for 2025- 26. SEMI forecasts that in 2025, the inspection equipment market will grow \(+23\%\) YoY and the assembly equipment market \(+8\%\) YoY. Corresponding figures for 2026 are \(+5\%\) and \(+15\%\) . We anticipate that growth in demand for Japanese- made back- end equipment will outpace that for front- end equipment in 2025- 26, for the following reasons. We believe China's ambitions to domestically produce back- end equipment are not as strong as they are for front- end equipment, and we also think that back- end equipment stands to benefit relatively more from increased AI- related investment.

Foundries and logic the largest market in 2025, but NAND seen rebounding: Equipment for foundries and logic makers accounts for over \(60\%\) of the WFE market, and SEMI forecasts that such demand will grow \(7\%\) YoY in 2025, \(6\%\) in 2026, and \(13\%\) in 2027 (the last due to increased investment in advanced nodes). Within memory chips, SEMI projects that demand for NAND equipment will recover significantly with a \(42\%\) YoY increase in 2025, followed by \(10\%\) growth in 2026 (to \(15bn\) ). Our forecasts are premised on a China- led recovery, meaning that we do not anticipate strong growth elsewhere. Meanwhile, SEMI forecasts that demand for DRAM equipment will grow by \(6\%\) in 2025 and \(12\%\) in 2026 (to \(23bn\) ). NAND equipment accounts for a high percentage of Kokusai Electric's sales.

Morgan Stanley uses a relative rating system using terms such as Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated or Underweight (see definitions below). Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold and sell. (as of July 31, 2025)

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm. For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal- weight and Not- Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Data include common stock and ADRs currently assigned ratings. Investment Banking Clients are companies from whom Morgan Stanley received investment banking compensation in the last 12 months. Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.
In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.
Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI ac Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
